contentrichtext.text: '''November 2001''': [[January 2001|January]] – [[February 2001|February]] – [[March 2001|March]] – [[April 2001|April]] – [[May 2001|May]] – [[June 2001|June]] – [[July 2001|July]] – [[August 2001|August]] – [[September 2001|September]] – [[October 2001|October]] – November – [[December 2001|December]] ---- ==Events== * November – [[The Doha Declaration]] slightly relaxes the grip of international [[intellectual property]]. * November – [[The Order of The Black Venus]] publishes [[Anton Szandor LaVey]]`s ''[[The Satanic Bible]]'' in [[Estonian language|Estonian]]. ===November 1, 2001=== * Derek Jeter hits the [[MLB]]'s first November [[home run]] at the [[2001 World Series#Game 4|World Series]]. ===November 4, 2001=== * [[Hurricane Michelle]] hits [[Cuba]], destroying crops and thousands of homes. * Establishment of the [[Police Service of Northern Ireland]] ===November 6, 2001=== * [[Twentieth Century Fox]]'s anti-terrorist drama action show ''[[24 (TV series)]]'' premieres. * [[Buffy the Vampire Slayer]]'s musical episode "Once More With Feeling" was premiered on the UPN network. ===November 7, 2001=== * The super-sonic commercial aircraft [[Concorde]] resumes flying after a 15-month break. ===November 12, 2001=== * In New York City, [[American Airlines Flight 587]] crashes minutes after takeoff from [[John F. Kennedy International Airport]], killing all 260 on-board. * [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|2001 Attack on Afghanistan]]: [[Taliban]] forces abandon [[Kabul]], the capital of rio [[Afghanistan]], ahead of advancing [[Afghan Northern Alliance]] troops (Northern Alliance fighters took Kabul on November 14). ===November 13, 2001=== * [[Doha Round]]: The [[World Trade Organization]] ends a four-day ministerial conference in [[Doha]], [[Qatar]]. * [[Symbionese Liberation Army]] member [[Kathleen Soliah]] (Sara Jane Olsen) withdraws her previous guilty plea. * [[War on Terrorism]]: In the first such act since [[World War II]], US President [[George W. Bush]] signs an executive order allowing [[military tribunal]]s against any foreigners suspected of having connections to terrorist acts or planned acts on the United States. ===November 15, 2001=== * The [[Xbox (console)|Xbox]] was released in the United States ===November 16, 2001=== * The first [[Harry Potter]] film, ''[[Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone]]'', is released, grossing [[United States dollar|US]] {{Nowrap|$975.8 million in first week}}, becoming the second highest grossing film around the world, behind ''[[Titanic (1997 film)|Titanic]]''. ===November 17, 2001=== * The animated [[Justice League]] cartoon premieres on Cartoon Network in America. ===November 18, 2001=== * The [[Nintendo]] [[GameCube]] is released in the United States and Canada. * The [[World Wrestling Entertainment|World Wrestling Federation]] defeated the [[Extreme Championship Wrestling|ECW]]–[[World Championship Wrestling|WCW]] [[The Alliance (professional wrestling)|alliance]] at [[Survivor Series (2001)|Survivor Series]] in [[Greensboro, North Carolina]] (The "Miracle in Greensboro") ===November 19, 2001=== * Now 50 That's What I Call Music is released! ===November 20, 2001=== * In Washington, D.C., US President [[George W. Bush]] dedicates the [[United States Department of Justice]] headquarters building as the [[Robert F. Kennedy Justice Building]], honoring the late [[Robert F. Kennedy]] on what would have been his 76th birthday. ===November 21, 2001=== * Disney's popular acclaimed animated series, ''Recess'' ends production. ===November 23, 2001=== * [[Convention on Cybercrime]] is signed in [[Budapest]], Hungary. ===November 24, 2001=== * [[Melanie Thornton]], the German/American Pop singer, also the former member of [[La Bouche]], dies in a plane crash going to [[Zürich]], Switzerland,along with Maria Serreno-Serreno and Nathaly Van Het Ende of the German dance band [[Passion Fruit (band)]]. ===November 29, 2001=== * [[George Harrison]] of the [[Beatles]] dies at the age of 58 from lung cancer in [[Hollywood, California]]. {{Events by month links}} [[Category:November|2001]] [[Category:2001|*2001-11]]
